intro: Glochidion gillespiei, commonly known as the Gillespie's glabrous hibiscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of northern Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, smooth, ovate leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers with five petals, which bloom during the wet season. It is an understory plant, often found growing in shaded, moist environments within dense forest canopies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
